# Day 1192

![[https://x.com/iamgingertrash/thread/1935808693943034348](https://x.com/iamgingertrash/thread/1935808693943034348)](https://miro.medium.com/1*QBEyt_94rtTXlASevnXeVg.png)

![[https://x.com/iamgingertrash/thread/1935808693943034348](https://x.com/iamgingertrash/thread/1935808693943034348)](https://miro.medium.com/1*jJDOSYHjVR_OjXPInUMLlA.png)

This tweet speaks about an "event horizon" growing linearly with FLOPs, and a psychosecurity threshold.

**As computational power (FLOPs) grows, especially in the form of AI, it drags consciousness toward a singularity, an event horizon.** If your _psychosecurity_ - your internal resilience to psychological manipulation - is not growing at a faster rate, you will cross a boundary of no return. You become absorbed, altered, perhaps permanently derailed by the gravity of the system according to this anon Twitter account I enjoy following.

---

Um. Okay. Pause. Shi* is simp right here?

Ironically, I turned to AI to help me define these terms so I could better grok the point and try to protect myself. What it shared with me, I think is worth sharing with you, dear reader.

- **Psychosecurity** = the ability to guard your mind from manipulation, disinformation, algorithmic hijacking, mental fragmentation.

- **FLOPs (Floating Point Operations Per Second)** = proxy for AI's raw computational power.

- **Event Horizon** = point of no return. In physics, once you cross a black hole's event horizon, no information can escape. Psychologically, the metaphor implies a similar collapse into irretrievable manipulation or mental disintegration.

So now the claim seems clearer:

> If your capacity to maintain your mental sovereignty isn't rising faster than the pace at which computational systems are evolving to manipulate you... you are getting sucked in.

It's a warning about psychological inertia.

Now the practical question: **How can we protect ourselves?** How do we build _psychosecurity_?

Let's break this apart.

---

## 1. Know thy enemy: Algorithmic Incentives

Every algorithm on social media is designed to optimize for one thing: **engagement**.

Not truth.
Not virtue.
Not depth.
Just... clicking, scrolling, watching, reacting.

And what causes that engagement?

- Outrage

- Fear

- Sex

- Tribal affirmation

- Dopamine spikes

- The infinite drip of novelty

- Short-form stimuli that reward _reflex_, not _reflection_

So if we're going to protect ourselves, we need to **first see the algorithm for what it is**: a machine learning demon trained on your weaknesses.

That's not hyperbole. It literally predicts your behavior by exploiting cognitive shortcuts and emotional triggers.

## 2. Set up your firewalls: Guard your inputs

Psychosecurity = Info hygiene.

- **Use RSS instead of social feeds**
 You choose _when_ and _what_ to consume. No algorithm curating.

- **Remove endless scroll and autoplay**
 Tools like [Unhook](https://unhook.app/) for YouTube or browser extensions that break infinite scroll loops can reset the environment. I tried it and just seeing my Youtube screen without all the suggestions did make me stop and go woah....

![So much less load on the brain not thinking about what should I listen to next](https://miro.medium.com/1*EWBLoaj0eejk4VGsgGBC-Q.png)

- **Read books.** Not summaries. Not tweets.
 Real books. With friction. With focus. With structure.

- **Slow down your news.**
 Use services like [The Browser](https://thebrowser.com/) or [Noema](https://www.noemamag.com/) or curated newsletters with low volume.

If your psychosecurity system is like an immune system, your _daily info intake_ is your diet. Most people are eating moldy Doritos 24/7 and wondering why they feel mentally ill.

## 3. Reflex vs. Reflection: Rewire the response loop

The algorithms are designed to shortcut your thinking:

- You see a tweet.

- You react emotionally.

- You repost or reply.

- You feel righteous.

- The loop continues.

This is a **reflex arc** - bypassing the slow, deliberative prefrontal cortex.

How do you reclaim it?

- **Wait before you share.** Give yourself 24 hours.

- **Ask yourself: "What does this _actually_ mean?"**

- **Write about it.** Writing forces you to think.

"Reading without reflecting is like eating without digesting."
We've become infovores with indigestion. Reflection is how you chew.

## 4. Build internal structures: Deep goals, long arcs

Short-form media shrinks your timeline.

Your goals get shorter. Your focus narrows. You live by the hour. You lose the long now.

But psychosecurity demands a sense of _teleology_ - a bigger why.

Some strategies:

- **Write a long-term plan.** Even if you revise it constantly.

- **Work on hard things that take time.** Learn piano. Write a book. Train for a marathon.

- **Measure in years, not clicks.**

When you have long arcs, you're harder to hijack. You're not tempted by every low-res emotional bait. You have trajectory.

## 5. Create your own feedback loop

You need _your own_ dopamine economy - one not pegged to algorithmic coin.

That means:

- **Daily rituals with no extrinsic reward** (writing, walking, prayer, coding, meditation)

- **Tracking progress on things _you_ value** (not likes or comments)

- **Feedback from people you trust**, not anonymous mobs

Build an **internal scoreboard**. When you have one, you no longer need the algorithm's one.

## 6. Be with people. In person. Often.

This one's not optional.

Most psychological derangement is a function of disconnection, alienation, hyperindividualism amplified by digital atomization.

Touch grass. Touch skin. Talk in real rooms.

Real humans are your best antivirus.

## 7. Practice mental fasting

Just as intermittent fasting strengthens the body, **info fasting strengthens the mind.**

- Try **no inputs after sunset**

- Or one day a week **no screens**

- Or even short retreats where **you don't consume anything**, only write, walk, think

If the singularity is a kind of mental overload collapse, then _emptiness_ becomes sacred.

## 8. Reclaim sacred time

Most people's **attention is colonized.**
They don't own their mornings. Or evenings. Or their dreams.

Win back:

- The **first hour** of your day (no phone, only creation or silence)

- The **last hour** (read physical books, reflect, talk, rest)

Own the bookends of your day = own your mind.

## 9. Understand the game: FLOPs aren't just tech - they're ideology

Every increase in AI capacity also brings an **increase in ideology scale.**

More FLOPs = more memetic weapons
More FLOPs = deeper personalization
More FLOPs = more _uncanny seduction_

And that means...
**Your _identity_ must be actively maintained.**

Because the default path is absorption.

If you are not **becoming someone**,
you are being shaped into something.

## 10. Have something to serve. Bigger than self.

If you worship your own emotions, you're easy to manipulate.

But if you serve a higher ideal - truth, love, freedom, Bitcoin, Family, God - something that gives you backbone.

Psychosecurity = Soul anchored in something stable.

Even the best FLOPs can't fake integrity.

So, to answer the question:

> _**How can we beat the algos designed to addict us?**_

We become deeper humans.

- With better inputs

- With reflective outputs

- With stronger identity

- With community

- With sovereignty of time, mind, and values

That's psychosecurity.

It won't be easy. But it's possible.

And necessary.

6/26/25

Conor Jay Chepenik
